com.apriori.concurrent

Class SettableRunnableFuture<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.concurrent.AbstractListenableFuture<T>
      • com.apriori.concurrent.SettableFuture<T>
        • com.apriori.concurrent.SettableRunnableFuture<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of future value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Awaitable, Cancellable, ListenableFuture<T>, java.util.concurrent.Future<T>

    public class SettableRunnableFuture<T>
extends SettableFuture<T>
    A runnable future that is also settable. Setting the value or cause of failure before execution of the associated task begins will prevent execution, much like cancelling other forms of runnable futures prevents task execution. Once the task runs and the value, or cause of failure, is set, subsequent attempts to set the value or cause of failure will not succeed.

    Unlike its superclass, SettableFuture, cancelling this kind of future can interrupt a running task.

    See Also:
    SettableFuture.asRunnableFuture(java.lang.Runnable)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SettableRunnableFuture

        public SettableRunnableFuture(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Constructs a new future that will run the given task. If the task completes successfully, the future will complete with a null value.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to run

      • SettableRunnableFuture

        public SettableRunnableFuture(java.lang.Runnable task,
                              T result)
        Constructs a new future that will run the given task. If the task completes successfully, the future will complete with the specified value.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to run
        result - the value of the future upon successful completion of the task

      • SettableRunnableFuture

        public SettableRunnableFuture(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> task)
        Constructs a new future that will run the given computation.
        Parameters:
        task - the computation to run, the result of which will be future's result upon successful completion

    • Method Detail

      • run

      • interrupt

        protected void interrupt()
        Description copied from class: AbstractListenableFuture
        Invoked when the task is cancelled and allowed to interrupt a running task. This method is invoked when cancel(true) is called and should perform the interruption, if such an operation is supported.

        This default implementation does nothing.

        Overrides:
        interrupt in class AbstractListenableFuture<T>
